subject: Baseball
Awards, Decorations and Honors
lead_paragraph: Cal Ripken, who broke Lou Gehrig’s record for consecutive games played, said Derek Jeter’s passing Gehrig for the most career hits by a Yankee was “a big deal.”
snippet: Cal Ripken, who broke Lou Gehrig’s record for consecutive games played, said Derek Jeter’s passing Gehrig for the most career hits by a Yankee was “a big deal.”
